pullRequest.body:
dualize the clique API to obtain independent sets, prove theorems about the dual relationship to cliques, dualize and add some theorems.

---

we only commit dual versions of theorems about the coclique number because we require them for a proof of mantels theorem. i have dualizations of most other theorems in the clique file, in case you also want those in this (or a subsequent) PR. give word if there are any other results you would like to see (maybe a refactor of graph partitions or a theorem about antichains?).

`lemma compl_independentSet_meets_every_edge` and `theorem isIndependentSet_neighborSet_if_triangleFree` are also required for our proof and included in this PR, but might be too specific for mathlib.

- [x] depends on: #18446 where all changes to the clique code origin
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

`+ isIndepSet_neighborSet_of_triangleFree`

* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18446~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Don't forget to remove `awaiting-author` once you have addressed all comments ðŸ˜‰
Thank you for doing this! It is long overdue
Could this be in the file about cliques? It seems better this way given that the two concepts are literally dual

Sure! I put it in a seperate file because I also dualized most theorems in the clique file and ended up with a lot of lines of code. If you don't think those dualizations should be in mathlib unless someone actually needs them, or don't mind long files, I'll append the code to the clique file.
I think the clique file is not so long yet, so merging seems appropriate

```suggestion
theorem isIndependentSet_neighborSet_of_triangleFree [DecidableEq Î±] (h: G.CliqueFree 3) (v : Î±) :
```

```suggestion
@[mk_iff]
structure IsNIndependentSet (n : â„•) (s : Finset Î±) where
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
theorem independentSetFree_iff_isCliqueFree_of_complement :
```

```suggestion
noncomputable def indepNum (G : SimpleGraph Î±) : â„• := sSup {n | âˆƒ s, G.IsNIndependentSet n s}
```
for "independence number"

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma cliqueNum_compl : Gá¶œ.cliqueNum = G.cocliqueNum := by
```
and can we also have `cocliqueNum_compl`?

I tried this just now, but the simpNF linter sees a problem I can't seem to reproduce locally:
```
/- The `simpNF` linter reports:
SOME SIMP LEMMAS ARE NOT IN SIMP-NORMAL FORM.
see note [simp-normal form] for tips how to debug this.
https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib_docs/notes.html#simp-normal%20form -/
-- Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.IndependentSet
Error: ././././Mathlib/Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/IndependentSet.lean:139:1: error: @SimpleGraph.cliqueNum_compl LINTER FAILED:
simplify fails on left-hand side:
tactic 'simp' failed, nested error:
maximum recursion depth has been reached
use `set_option maxRecDepth <num>` to increase limit
use `set_option diagnostics true` to get diagnostic information
```
I only found anecdotal descriptions of the normal form in the manuals and am now confused. Ideas?

You missed something very important about my suggestion: I am putting the `á¶œ` on the LHS rather than the RHS. Since simp always rewrites left to right, adding both `G.cliqueNum = Gá¶œ.cocliqueNum` and `G.cocliqueNum = Gá¶œ.cliqueNum` means that it rewrites `G.cocliqueNum` to `Gá¶œ.cliqueNum` to `Gá¶œá¶œ.cocliqueNum` to `Gá¶œá¶œá¶œ.cliqueNum`...
Oh my, that is very important indeed! Walking right into a trap with my very first simp lemma :D

I'd say
```suggestion
abbrev IsIndepSet (s : Set Î±) : Prop :=
```
to keep things reasonably short (and roughly as long as `IsClique`)

```suggestion
```

Similarly to `cliqueNum`, I would suggest
```suggestion
theorem isClique_compl : Gá¶œ.IsClique s â†” G.IsIndepSet s := by
```
and could we also get `isIndepSet_compl`?

I doubt they can be marked `simp` because `IsIndepSet` and `IsClique` are `abbrev`s. But maybe that's a sign that they shouldn't be `abbrev`s... ðŸ¤”

Did you mean this to be a docstring?
```suggestion
/-- If `s` is an independent set, its complement meets every edge of `G`. -/
```

```suggestion
lemma IsIndepSet.nonempty_mem_compl_mem_edge
    [Fintype Î±] [DecidableEq Î±] {s : Finset Î±} (indA : G.IsIndepSet s) {e} (he : e âˆˆ G.edgeSet)
    {b âˆˆ sá¶œ | b âˆˆ e}.Nonempty := by
```
maybe

pullRequest.title: feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): add independent sets
